org.commonvox.insight.anomaly_detector

Class User

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.commonvox.insight.anomaly_detector.User
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<User>

    public class User
extends Object
implements Comparable<User>
    An instance of the User class serves as the container for friends and recent purchases of a user, and the User class crucially provides the #getAnomalyData method, which invokes anomaly-detection on each of a user's new purchases.
    Author:
    Daniel Vimont

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void addPurchase(String timestamp, Integer amount)
      Add purchase transaction to internally-maintained collection, with placement in the collection dependent on transaction timestamp and purchase threshold setting.
      protected void addPurchase(String timestamp, String amountString)
      Add purchase transaction to internally-maintained collection, with placement in the collection dependent on transaction timestamp and purchase threshold setting.
      protected void befriend(String timestamp, User otherUser)
      Adds the submitted User to this User's "friends" collection.
      int compareTo(User other) 
      boolean equals(Object obj) 
      protected static Collection<User> getAllUsers()
      Returns a Collection of all instantiated User objects in user-id order.
      protected int[] getAnomalyData(Integer amount)
      Determines whether the submitted purchase amount is an anomaly, and if so, returns a two-element array consisting of (a) the mean, and (b) the standard deviation that formed the basis for the anomaly computation; if submitted purchase amount is NOT an anomaly, returns null.
      protected static int getDegreesOfSeparation()
      Get the class-variable setting for "degrees of separation", which establishes how User networks are derived.
      protected NavigableSet<User> getFriends()
      Returns NavigableSet of user's friends
      protected String getId()
      Returns id, which uniquely identifies User instance.
      protected NavigableSet<User> getNetwork()
      Returns NavigableSet of all users in this user's network.
      protected static User getOrCreateUser(String id)
      Either gets existing User identified by the submitted id, or if no such User exists, creates and returns a new User instantiated with the submitted id.
      protected static void setDegreesOfSeparation(int classDegreesOfSeparation)
      Set the value of "degrees of separation" class variable, establishing how User networks will be derived.
      String toString() 
      protected void unfriend(String timestamp, User otherUser)
      Removes the submitted User from this User's "friends" collection.

      • befriend

        protected void befriend(String timestamp,
                        User otherUser)
        Adds the submitted User to this User's "friends" collection. SPECIAL NOTE on #befriend processing: invocation of the #befriend method will have no effect if the submitted timestamp precedes the timestamp of the most recent (already-submitted) #unfriend transaction.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp for befriend transaction
        otherUser - user to be befriended

      • unfriend

        protected void unfriend(String timestamp,
                        User otherUser)
        Removes the submitted User from this User's "friends" collection. SPECIAL NOTE on #unfriend processing: invocation of the #unfriend method will have no effect if the submitted timestamp precedes the timestamp of the most recent (already-submitted) #befriend transaction.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp for unfriend transaction
        otherUser - user to be unfriended

      • addPurchase

        protected void addPurchase(String timestamp,
                           String amountString)
        Add purchase transaction to internally-maintained collection, with placement in the collection dependent on transaction timestamp and purchase threshold setting.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp of purchase transaction
        amountString - amount of purchase transaction in String format

      • addPurchase

        protected void addPurchase(String timestamp,
                           Integer amount)
        Add purchase transaction to internally-maintained collection, with placement in the collection dependent on transaction timestamp and purchase threshold setting.
        Parameters:
        timestamp - timestamp of purchase transaction
        amount - amount of purchase transaction in pennies

      • getAnomalyData

        protected int[] getAnomalyData(Integer amount)
        Determines whether the submitted purchase amount is an anomaly, and if so, returns a two-element array consisting of (a) the mean, and (b) the standard deviation that formed the basis for the anomaly computation; if submitted purchase amount is NOT an anomaly, returns null.
        Parameters:
        amount - purchase amount in pennies
        Returns:
        null if amount is not an anomaly; otherwise, returns a two-element int array consisting of (a) mean and (b) standard deviation that formed basis of anomaly computation
